sections.title: Key Planning Documents
sections.preview_public_html: To get a basic idea of a retirement plan's sustainability, you need a Net Worth Statement and a Cash Flow Statement. This section provides a clear overview of both documents, explaining their purpose and what information they provide to help you better understand your financial health.
sections.section_public_html:
Net Worth and Cash Flow Statements

A **Net Worth Statement** provides a global overview of your financial situation, helping you identify your overall savings available for retirement. A **Cash Flow Statement** details annual inflows and outflows, enabling a deeper analysis of where your money is coming from and going to. This foundational understanding is vital for pinpointing areas for improvement and making informed decisions.

sub_objectives.title: Positive Cash Flow
sub_objectives.teaser_public: Positive cash flow is the new money available to save or deploy after all current expenses are met.

sections.title: Compounding Interest
sections.preview_public_html: Compounding interest is the reinvestment of interest to grow an investment over time. It is the key to offsetting long-term inflation and building foundational wealth. This section explains the principle of compounding and its importance for long-term financial stability.
sections.section_public_html:
The Power of Compounding Interest

The essence of wealth creation is setting money aside for a very long time, allowing compounding interest to work its magic. This overview will help you understand the concept of compounding and its role as a hedge against inflation. You will also learn why having short-term cash reserves allows you to capture long-term compounding interest with other money.

sub_objectives.title: Using the Time Value of Money
sub_objectives.teaser_public: Understanding the time value of money is essential for predicting the long-term sustainability of a financial plan.
